intro: Chamissoa stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf chamissoa, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Chamissoa stricta typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as grasslands and slopes. It is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, including parts of California and Oregon.
